quote: My father might not have held my hand or expressed his love openly, but he taught Callie and me that we had inherent values, that we were fully formed human beings without a boy by our side.
quote_letters: MY FATHER MIGHT NOT HAVE HELD MY HAND OR EXPRESSED HIS LOVE OPENLY BUT HE TAUGHT CALLIE AND ME THAT WE HAD INHERENT VALUES THAT WE WERE FULLY FORMED HUMAN BEINGS WITHOUT A BOY BY OUR SIDE
source: Amy Engel, The Book of Ivy
